intro: Lithospermum sibthorpianum, commonly known as the Sibthorp's lithosperm, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, while its flowers are clustered in racemes. The roots of Lithospermum sibthorpianum contain compounds with potential medicinal properties.
